title: Philippians Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Philippians chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Philippians Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Philippians Chapter 4.

questions.question: Who does Paul beseech to be of the same mind in the Lord?
questions.correctAnswer: Euodias and Syntyche
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:2 specifically mentions Paul beseeching Euodias and Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4:4, what are believers instructed to do always?
questions.correctAnswer: Rejoice in the Lord
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:4 states, 'Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.'

questions.question: What should your requests be made known unto God with, according to Philippians 4:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer and supplication with thanksgiving
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:6 instructs to present requests to God by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving.

questions.question: What does the peace of God do according to Philippians 4:7?
options: Keeps your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Keeps your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:7 explains that the peace of God will keep hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.

questions.question: Which qualities should believers think on, according to Philippians 4:8?
options: True, honest, just, pure, lovely, of good report
questions.correctAnswer: True, honest, just, pure, lovely, of good report
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:8 lists these qualities as things to think on.

questions.question: In Philippians 4:10, what caused Paul to rejoice greatly?
questions.correctAnswer: Their renewed care for him
questions.explanation: Paul rejoiced because the Philippians' care for him flourished again as stated in Philippians 4:10.

questions.question: What has Paul learned to be, regardless of his circumstances, according to Philippians 4:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Content
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:11 says Paul learned to be content in whatever state he is in.

questions.question: Through whom does Paul say he can do all things?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ which strengtheneth me
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:13 states Paul can do all things through Christ who strengthens him.

questions.question: Who did Paul mention as having communicated with his affliction?
questions.correctAnswer: The Philippians
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:14 commends the Philippians for communicating with Paul's affliction.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4:18, what did Paul receive from Epaphroditus?
options: An odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable to God
questions.correctAnswer: An odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable to God
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:18 describes the gift from Epaphroditus as a sweet-smelling sacrifice acceptable to God.

questions.question: True or False: Philippians 4:23 says 'The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.'
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:23 closes with a blessing of grace from the Lord Jesus Christ to all.

questions.question: True or False: Philippians 4:5 says 'Be careful for everything; the Lord is far away.'
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:5 actually says 'Be careful for nothing' and 'The Lord is at hand,' so the statement is false.

questions.question: True or False: Philippians 4:16 mentions that the Thessalonians sent help to Paul once and again.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:16 confirms the Thessalonians sent aid to Paul multiple times.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Philippians 4:1: 'Therefore, my brethren dearly beloved and longed for, my joy and ______, so stand fast in the Lord, my dearly beloved.'
questions.correctAnswer: crown
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:1 refers to the brethren as Paul's joy and crown.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Philippians 4:19: 'But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in ______ by Christ Jesus.'
questions.correctAnswer: glory
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:19 says God will supply needs according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

medium.title: Philippians Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Philippians Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with anxiety about daily needs. Based on Philippians 4, what biblical truth would you share to encourage them?
options: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.
Ignore your worries and focus only on work.
Trust only in your own strength and abilities.
Avoid thinking about your needs to reduce stress.
questions.correctAnswer: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:6 teaches that believers should not be anxious but present their requests to God with prayer and thanksgiving, assuring peace from God (Philippians 4:7). This encourages trust and dependence on God rather than anxiety.

questions.question: How does Philippians 4 instruct believers to maintain their attitude toward life circumstances?
options: Learn to be content in whatever state you are.
Always expect more blessings and avoid hardships.
Compare yourself to others to find motivation.
Focus only on prosperous times and ignore trials.
questions.correctAnswer: Learn to be content in whatever state you are.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:11-12 emphasizes learning contentment in all situations, whether in abundance or need, teaching humility and trust in God's provision.

questions.question: A church leader is dealing with conflict between two members. What guidance does Philippians 4 offer regarding unity?
options: Beseech Euodias and Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord.
Ignore the conflict and hope it resolves itself.
Take sides and encourage division for clarity.
Exclude those in conflict from fellowship.
questions.correctAnswer: Beseech Euodias and Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:2 calls for believers to be united in spirit and purpose, highlighting the importance of reconciliation and harmony within the church.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4, what kind of things should believers focus their thoughts on to maintain spiritual health?
options: Whatsoever things are true, honest, just, pure, lovely, and of good report.
The latest worldly trends and pleasures.
Only on their personal ambitions and desires.
Things that cause worry and fear.
questions.correctAnswer: Whatsoever things are true, honest, just, pure, lovely, and of good report.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:8 instructs believers to meditate on virtuous and praiseworthy things, cultivating a godly mindset that leads to peace and holiness.

questions.question: What promise does Philippians 4 give about the peace God provides to those who trust Him?
options: The peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
Peace will come only after all problems are solved.
Peace depends on our own efforts and achievements.
Peace is a feeling that comes and goes randomly.
questions.correctAnswer: The peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:7 promises God’s peace that transcends human understanding, guarding hearts and minds through faith in Christ, assuring spiritual stability amidst trials.

questions.question: A believer is feeling weak and overwhelmed by challenges. According to Philippians 4, what source of strength should they rely on?
options: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
Rely solely on personal determination and willpower.
Seek strength only through human support.
questions.correctAnswer: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:13 reminds believers that Christ empowers them to endure and overcome difficulties, emphasizing reliance on divine strength rather than self.

questions.question: What attitude toward generosity is taught in Philippians 4 concerning giving and receiving support?
options: The desire is for fruit that may abound to your account, not just gifts.
Giving should be done reluctantly and sparingly.
Only receive support, do not give to others.
Giving should be done publicly for recognition.
questions.correctAnswer: The desire is for fruit that may abound to your account, not just gifts.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:17 highlights that true generosity seeks spiritual fruit and blessing rather than just material gifts, encouraging a heart of stewardship and blessing.

questions.question: True or False: According to Philippians 4, believers should always rejoice in the Lord regardless of circumstances.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:4 commands believers to rejoice in the Lord always, emphasizing joy as a continual attitude grounded in faith, independent of external situations.

questions.question: How does Philippians 4 teach believers to treat others in the church family?
options: Salute every saint in Christ Jesus and greet one another warmly.
Ignore others’ needs and focus on personal growth.
Only associate with those who agree with you.
Avoid greeting those outside your immediate group.
questions.correctAnswer: Salute every saint in Christ Jesus and greet one another warmly.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:21-22 shows Paul’s encouragement for mutual greetings and fellowship among believers, fostering unity and love within the church.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen." This blessing is found in Philippians 4:__.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:23 concludes the chapter with a blessing of grace from the Lord Jesus Christ, affirming God’s presence with all believers.

questions.question: In Philippians 4, Paul mentions a person who delivered gifts from the Philippians. Who was this person?
questions.correctAnswer: Epaphroditus
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:18 refers to Epaphroditus as the one who brought the gifts from the Philippians, described as a sweet-smelling sacrifice acceptable to God.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4, what should a believer’s moderation or gentleness be known to?
questions.correctAnswer: All men
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:5 instructs that believers' moderation or gentleness should be evident to everyone, reflecting Christlike character publicly.

questions.question: True or False: Paul expresses gratitude that the Philippians had renewed their care for him, even though they previously lacked opportunity to show it.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:10 acknowledges Paul's rejoicing that the Philippians' concern for him has flourished again, showing the importance of mutual care in the body of Christ.

questions.question: Which of the following best summarizes the practical Christian living advice given in Philippians 4:9?
options: Practice what you have learned, received, heard, and seen in Paul to have the God of peace with you.
Focus only on your own interpretation of Scripture.
Avoid following examples and focus on personal feelings.
Wait passively for God to act without doing anything.
questions.correctAnswer: Practice what you have learned, received, heard, and seen in Paul to have the God of peace with you.
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:9 encourages believers to actively live out the teachings and example of Paul, promising God’s peace as a result of obedience and imitation of godly conduct.

questions.question: What does Philippians 4:19 say about God’s provision for believers?
options: God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
God will provide only when you earn it.
Believers must provide for themselves without expecting help.
Provision depends on community resources alone.
questions.correctAnswer: God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
questions.explanation: This verse assures believers that God’s abundant riches in Christ will meet all their needs, encouraging trust in God’s faithful provision.

hard.title: Philippians Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Philippians Chapter 4.

questions.question: In Philippians 4:3, Paul refers to a 'true yokefellow' who is asked to help certain women. What is the significance of this term in the context of Greco-Roman cultural and religious imagery?
options: A fellow worker sharing the same spiritual burden
A Roman official overseeing the church
A metaphor for a slave bound to labor
A title for the head of the synagogue
questions.correctAnswer: A fellow worker sharing the same spiritual burden
questions.explanation: The term 'yokefellow' (Philippians 4:3) metaphorically refers to a partner sharing the same yoke, symbolizing unity and shared labor in the gospel mission, reflecting a common Greco-Roman image of partnership in work.

questions.question: Philippians 4:6 instructs believers to present their requests to God 'with thanksgiving.' Which Old Testament book similarly emphasizes thanksgiving as an integral part of prayer, showing thematic continuity?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalms
questions.explanation: Psalms frequently pairs prayer with thanksgiving, mirroring Philippians 4:6's instruction, thereby demonstrating the early Christian reliance on Jewish prayer traditions and continuity in worship practice.

questions.question: The phrase 'the peace of God, which passeth all understanding' in Philippians 4:7 is an example of what rhetorical literary device?
questions.correctAnswer: Paradox
questions.explanation: This phrase (Philippians 4:7) presents a paradox, as divine peace surpasses human comprehension, highlighting the transcendent nature of God's peace beyond rational explanation.

questions.question: In Philippians 4:8, Paul lists qualities believers should meditate on. This list resembles which Jewish ethical teaching method that uses enumerations to guide moral behavior?
questions.correctAnswer: Didactic enumeration
questions.explanation: Paul's list in Philippians 4:8 employs didactic enumeration, a teaching technique common in Jewish wisdom literature, where virtues are systematically listed to instruct ethical living.

questions.question: How does Paul's statement 'I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me' in Philippians 4:13 function as a theological climax in the chapter's structure?
options: It serves as a central affirmation of divine empowerment amid trials
It introduces a new theme unrelated to previous verses
questions.correctAnswer: It serves as a central affirmation of divine empowerment amid trials
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:13 serves as a theological climax, encapsulating Paul's theme of reliance on Christ's strength in all circumstances, reinforcing the chapter's message of joy and contentment through divine power.

questions.question: The reference to 'the book of life' in Philippians 4:3 has strong intertextual connections to which Old Testament prophetic book?
questions.correctAnswer: Daniel
questions.explanation: The 'book of life' (Philippians 4:3) echoes Daniel 12:1, where those written in the book are delivered, symbolizing divine election and eternal life, thus linking Paul's teaching to Jewish eschatological hope.

questions.question: Which Greek word for 'rejoice' in Philippians 4:4 carries connotations of a deep, spiritual joy despite external circumstances?
questions.correctAnswer: Chairo
questions.explanation: 'Chairo' (Philippians 4:4) denotes joyfulness and gladness rooted in spiritual reality rather than external conditions, underscoring Paul's exhortation to constant joy.

questions.question: True or False: Paul’s mention of Caesar’s household in Philippians 4:22 indicates that Christianity had begun to penetrate the Roman imperial environment.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:22 mentions saints in Caesar's household, reflecting early Christian presence even within the Roman imperial context, showing the gospel's reach into diverse social strata.

questions.question: In Philippians 4:11-12, Paul discusses learning to be content in various states. This reflects which Stoic philosophical concept prevalent in the ancient Mediterranean world?
questions.correctAnswer: Autarkeia (self-sufficiency)
questions.explanation: Paul's teaching on contentment (Philippians 4:11-12) resonates with 'autarkeia,' the Stoic ideal of self-sufficiency and inner stability regardless of external conditions, though he grounds it in Christ rather than philosophy.

questions.question: How does the final doxology in Philippians 4:20 connect to the overall theme of God's sovereignty in the letter?
options: It summarizes the recognition of God’s eternal glory
It introduces a new theological topic
questions.correctAnswer: It summarizes the recognition of God’s eternal glory
questions.explanation: The doxology (Philippians 4:20) encapsulates the letter’s emphasis on God's sovereign glory, affirming ultimate praise directed toward God as the source of all strength and provision.

questions.question: Paul’s appeal for Euodias and Syntyche to agree in Philippians 4:2 employs which rhetorical strategy common in ancient letter-writing to foster unity?
questions.correctAnswer: Direct exhortation to harmony
questions.explanation: In Philippians 4:2, Paul uses direct exhortation, a common epistolary strategy, urging Euodias and Syntyche to be of the same mind to maintain unity crucial for communal witness.

questions.question: Which Old Testament concept is foreshadowed by Paul's assurance in Philippians 4:19 that God will supply 'according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus'?
options: The provision of manna in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: The provision of manna in the wilderness
questions.explanation: Paul’s promise in Philippians 4:19 echoes God’s provision of manna (Exodus 16) as a type of divine sustenance, now fulfilled spiritually through Christ's provision.

questions.question: In Philippians 4:18, Paul uses the imagery of a 'sacrifice acceptable, wellpleasing to God.' This alludes to which Old Testament sacrificial system?
questions.correctAnswer: The peace offerings
questions.explanation: The phrase in Philippians 4:18 recalls peace offerings, which were sacrifices expressing fellowship and gratitude to God, signifying that the gifts brought by Epaphroditus were spiritually pleasing.

questions.question: Paul's instruction in Philippians 4:5, 'Let your moderation be known unto all men,' uses a Greek term often translated as what?
questions.correctAnswer: Gentleness
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'epieikes' in Philippians 4:5 is often translated as gentleness or reasonableness, highlighting a Christian virtue of measured, gracious behavior towards others.

questions.question: True or False: Philippians 4:14-16 highlights the Philippians as the only church to support Paul financially during his ministry.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:15-16 clarify that while the Philippians were the only church to communicate with Paul at the start of his gospel mission, other churches like Thessalonica also sent support later.

theological.title: Philippians Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Philippians Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4:6, what is the prescribed Christian response to anxiety or worry?
options: Be careful for nothing but pray with thanksgiving
Ignore the situation and trust fate
Rely solely on human wisdom and counsel
questions.correctAnswer: Be careful for nothing but pray with thanksgiving
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:6 instructs believers to not be anxious but to present their requests to God through prayer and thanksgiving. This aligns with 1 Peter 5:7, Matthew 6:25-34, Psalm 55:22, Isaiah 41:10, and John 14:27, which all encourage trusting God and casting anxieties on Him.

questions.question: What does Philippians 4:13 teach about the believer's strength?
options: Believers can do all things through Christ who strengthens them
Believers must rely on their own strength
Strength comes only from human wisdom
Strength is irrelevant in the Christian life
questions.correctAnswer: Believers can do all things through Christ who strengthens them
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:13 emphasizes that strength for all things comes through Christ. This truth is echoed in Isaiah 40:29-31, 2 Corinthians 12:9-10, Ephesians 3:16, and Psalm 28:7, demonstrating reliance on divine strength rather than self-sufficiency.

questions.question: In Philippians 4:8, believers are exhorted to meditate on things that are true, honest, just, pure, lovely, and of good report. What theological principle does this reflect?
options: The law of Moses as the highest rule
The rejection of all worldly knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: The sanctification of the mind
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:8 calls for a renewed and holy mindset, reflecting sanctification (Romans 12:2, Colossians 3:2, 2 Timothy 1:7, Psalm 119:15, Proverbs 4:23). This transformation of thought aligns with the biblical call to live holy and pleasing to God.

questions.question: What is the role of peace as described in Philippians 4:7?
options: God's peace guards hearts and minds through Christ Jesus
Peace is a human achievement through meditation
Peace is temporary and based on circumstances
Peace is only for the Old Testament saints
questions.correctAnswer: God's peace guards hearts and minds through Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:7 states that God's peace, surpassing human understanding, will guard believers' hearts and minds in Christ. This is consistent with John 14:27, Isaiah 26:3, Colossians 3:15, Romans 15:13, and Psalm 4:8, showing peace as a divine gift sustaining believers.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4:19, how does God supply the needs of believers?
options: According to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus
Only through human effort and provision
Only to those who are wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: According to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:19 teaches that God supplies all needs according to His glorious riches through Christ. This theological truth is supported by 2 Corinthians 9:8, Matthew 6:33, Psalm 23:1, Ephesians 3:20, and Romans 8:32, affirming God’s faithful provision.

questions.question: In Philippians 4:3, Paul calls someone a 'true yokefellow.' What is the significance of this term in the ecclesiological context?
options: A fellow laborer united in gospel ministry
A person who carries physical burdens
questions.correctAnswer: A fellow laborer united in gospel ministry
questions.explanation: The term 'true yokefellow' (Philippians 4:3) denotes a close partner in gospel work, emphasizing unity and cooperation in ministry. This is echoed in 1 Corinthians 3:9, 2 Corinthians 6:1, Acts 16:10, Romans 16:3-4, and Ecclesiastes 4:9-12, highlighting collaborative service in the church.

questions.question: How does Paul describe his attitude toward circumstances in Philippians 4:11-12?
options: He has learned contentment in all states
He avoids suffering at all costs
He depends on others for comfort
questions.correctAnswer: He has learned contentment in all states
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:11-12 reveals Paul’s learned contentment regardless of abundance or need, reflecting a mature trust in God. This aligns with 1 Timothy 6:6-8, Hebrews 13:5, Matthew 6:25-34, Psalm 34:10, and 2 Corinthians 12:10, teaching believers to be content in God's provision.

questions.question: What does Philippians 4:17 reveal about Paul's motivation for receiving support from the Philippians?
options: He desires fruit that may abound to their account
questions.correctAnswer: He desires fruit that may abound to their account
questions.explanation: Paul in Philippians 4:17 states his goal is spiritual fruit benefiting the Philippians, not material gain. This matches 2 Corinthians 9:6-8, Galatians 6:7-10, Luke 6:38, Romans 15:28, and John 4:36, emphasizing generosity as investment in eternal rewards.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4:4, how often should believers rejoice in the Lord?
questions.correctAnswer: Always
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:4 commands believers to rejoice always in the Lord. This continual joy is consistent with Nehemiah 8:10, 1 Thessalonians 5:16, Psalm 118:24, Habakkuk 3:17-18, and Luke 10:20, showing joy as a fruit of the Spirit regardless of circumstances.

questions.question: What does Paul attribute as the ultimate source of joy and crown in Philippians 4:1?
options: The brethren dearly beloved and longed for
questions.correctAnswer: The brethren dearly beloved and longed for
questions.explanation: Paul calls the Philippian believers his joy and crown in Philippians 4:1, highlighting the relational joy found in the body of Christ. This is supported by 1 Thessalonians 2:19-20, 1 Corinthians 9:25, Revelation 2:10, John 15:11, and Hebrews 12:2, emphasizing joy in faithfulness and fellowship.

questions.question: In Philippians 4:9, Paul promises that the 'God of peace' will be with those who do what?
options: Practice what they have learned, received, heard, and seen in Paul
questions.correctAnswer: Practice what they have learned, received, heard, and seen in Paul
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:9 teaches that obedience to apostolic example brings the presence of the God of peace. This principle resonates with James 1:22, John 13:15, 1 John 2:6, Hebrews 13:20-21, and Romans 16:20, showing the blessing of faithful obedience.

questions.question: What ecclesiological truth is illustrated by the Philippians' unique generosity described in Philippians 4:15-16?
options: The partnership and mutual support within the early church
The rejection of financial support for ministry
questions.correctAnswer: The partnership and mutual support within the early church
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:15-16 highlights the Philippians’ unique and ongoing financial partnership with Paul, illustrating early church mutual care. This is consistent with Acts 2:44-45, 1 Corinthians 16:1-4, 2 Corinthians 8:1-7, Galatians 6:6, and Romans 15:26, underscoring collective responsibility.

questions.question: How does Philippians 4:14 commend the Philippians in relation to Paul's affliction?
options: They shared in Paul's affliction through communication
questions.correctAnswer: They shared in Paul's affliction through communication
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:14 praises the Philippians for their partnership in Paul's suffering, reflecting the biblical principle of bearing one another’s burdens (Galatians 6:2, 2 Corinthians 1:5, Romans 12:15, Hebrews 13:3, John 15:13).

questions.question: What does Philippians 4:5 reveal about the believer's conduct toward others?
options: Let your moderation be known to all men
questions.correctAnswer: Let your moderation be known to all men
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:5 calls for moderation or gentleness to be evident to everyone, reflecting Christlike humility. This aligns with Titus 3:2, Proverbs 15:1, Colossians 4:6, Ephesians 4:2, and Matthew 5:5, encouraging gracious and gentle Christian witness.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4:18, how does Paul describe the gifts sent by the Philippians through Epaphroditus?
options: An odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, well-pleasing to God
questions.correctAnswer: An odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, well-pleasing to God
questions.explanation: Philippians 4:18 depicts the Philippians' gift as a pleasing sacrifice to God, reminiscent of Old Testament sacrificial language (e.g., Leviticus 1:9, Ephesians 5:2, Romans 12:1, Hebrews 13:16, Psalm 141:2), indicating that their generosity is spiritually significant.
